website_summaries.verdict: This orchestra in a box allows little ones to select individual instruments featured in classical songs.
pros: A fun early introduction to classical music
Teaches children how each instrument and sound plays a role in music
Little ones get to “compose” music or listen to the instruments together
Lights pulse to the rhythm for visual effect
cons: A bit bulky, and may be difficult for smaller babies to grip
Tunes could play a little longer

customer_reviews.title: Must Have
customer_reviews.text: This hands down is our sons (6 mo) faviorate toy. I hate noisy toys. Lights too as they just scream cheap. This cube, however, is amazing. He plays with it for up to 15 minutes many times a day. I never get sick of the songs. Like another reviewer said, it's the perfect size for the baby to use as a counter balance while learning to sit up. Every baby/parent needs this toy. If they came out with another cube with new songs/insterments I would buy it in a hearbeat! Munchkin, of your reading this please come out with one that has a Souzaphone! Babys dad plays the souzaphone! Or one with a banjo that has bluegrass music!
customer_reviews.author: KevinTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Cube broke after 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: We loved this toy...for the first 2 weeks. Our son always plays with this while supervised and it hasn't been handled roughly, however, after 2 weeks the sides have slowly stopped working. Now the only side that still plays is the red/harp side. For 2 weeks of entertainment, this wasn't worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Maya S Zahn

customer_reviews.title: Best music baby toy
customer_reviews.text: Least annoying baby music toy out there. I hate toys that make noise. And I throw most of them away. I'm more into wood toys, and toys that are "active" as opposed this "passive" (push button and listen) toy. However.... I had the old model and after 3 years it broke and I immediately bought this one for baby #2 to keep playing with it. It's the only toy my 3 year old plays with that she has been playing with since a baby. She jumps and dances to it and we've made up games to play with the buttons. In the dollar-per-hour-of-play formula I use to measure value... this one wins
customer_reviews.author: Momofthree

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of our favorite toys. By which I mean I love it just as much as my 1 year old does. She's been playing with it since about 11 months. I was amazed at how quickly she figured it out and "builds" her instrumentation. All her little play groupies love it too. You will definitely have these songs stuck in your head...but so much better than Raffi;) Also, she routinely drops it on the hardwood floor, and it still looks and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Alli

customer_reviews.title: Great toy, not a great place to purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic toy. Great lights and music, my seven month old loooooved it. Unfortunately after playing with it for a few minutes I realized the harp section didn't light up when it played, "no matter, I'll just exchange it" I thought. Well I just got the replacement and the new one has deep scratches all over it. I'm going to return and purchase from Target. They also have fast and free shipping (over $35, but who doesn't spend that much anytime they order form Target?). Super disappointed in Amazon's suppliers, and have been for awhile. Hope they can turn things around. Until then I'll be doing my shopping at Target online.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of My Son's Favorite toys
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this toy. When he pushes one of the large buttons it plays a song. Press two and both songs play. He plays with this over and over again and it has three items he loves - a button to push, lights and music. Ideal for him and I think for lots of babies. Note he was not strong enough to push the buttons until six or seven months of age but once he was strong enough this was a toy he went back to over and over again. Seems to be well made - it has been dropped many times and still works fine. Also the music is pleasant classical music.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: Nice. Very durable.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my granddaughter when she was one. She just turned three and I see her using it more creatively now! She hits the music and starts to dance around and when it stops, she freezes and holds her position. I see her enjoying it more now than when younger. Her 9 month old sister can easily hit it to get it to play music. I’m sure it is stimulating her brain due to cause and effect as well as the music itself. So I guess what I’m saying this toy has unexpected longevity, lol.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Baby's First Musical Instrument
customer_reviews.text: Several years ago, this was in the shape of a cube. I ordered it thinking it was still cube shaped because I liked the rest of the toy. Now I like the fact that the corners are now rounded for safety reasons. It was a gift for a sixth month old baby who is now beginning to play with it. The Mozart tunes are nicely played with each " instrument" having a part. Then when two or more sides are pushed, each "instrument" plays with resulting harmony until there is a whole orchestral sound with all buttons pushed. I certainly recommend it .
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Risdahl

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE...This is nice. Keeps my baby occupied for a few minutes. Shs is 5 mths. My baby is 11 mths now. She loves this so much to the point it annoys me. She will play it and as it stops doesnt matter what she is doing she stops and go press it again. I love that she loves it. We have been out of town a few times and i always bring it with us
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne grizzle

customer_reviews.title: It feels more sturdy, we'll see how it holds up
customer_reviews.text: UPDATED REVIEW: This toy has broken after less than a month. I thought the batteries were drained but I changed them a it still won't play. None of the buttons work. I'm so disappointed because it was my 17 month old's favorite toy. We owned a previous version of this and it stopped working after a while and the on/off button was finicky. This is a major improvement. They added two volume options and the shape allows it to roll when thrown, which makes so much more sense for a baby toy. It feels more sturdy, we'll see how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: Best music toy out there
customer_reviews.text: I got this foe my son when he was 5 months old. He is now 8 months and it is by far his favorite toy! I love that you can either play all the instruments together or toggle different ones on and off as you like so you can hear the different sounds. It sounds like the actual instruments too, not just auto tuning like a lot of the other toys so it is still somewhat enjoyable for parents to listen to. I will definitely gift this one to any new moms.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Meiers

customer_reviews.title: Not our favorite
customer_reviews.text: We like other music balls/boxes much better. I wish it played more songs as it gets fairly repetitive. I do like how you can play just one instrument at once. I enjoy hearing just the harp!
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Cheapened version from the original Mozart Cube
customer_reviews.text: I had bought a Mozart Cube twenty years ago before buying this one. If my memory serves me correctly, and I think it does, besides the color being different in the older version, more importantly, so was the instrumentation. The older version used real instruments for its sounds. This newer version uses a cheap sounding synthesizer for every instrument. Mozart's eight titles (including Non Piu Andrai and Der Vogelfanger) of music which allows a child to arrange instrumentation is a great toy. But if you love Mozart's music and/or classical instruments, then you will be very disappointed or at least very annoyed.
customer_reviews.author: KASHIWA

customer_reviews.title: My Grand Niece Totally Rocks Out to This
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my nephew's 18 month old daughter who right off the bat seemed to really like music. She loves this, it's a regular go to toy for her. She whacks the colored circles to keep the music going and she dances away (no small feat when the music is Mozart and not the Stones). This same item is twice as much in a catalog I got so the Amazon purchase is the way to go. I recommend it for any baby who shows an interest in music, and certainly the classical aspect is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: P. Kalafarski

customer_reviews.title: very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the original one for my nephew over nine years ago, it still works, on the other hand we purchased this one for our newborn March 25th and the flute, the Fox, don't light up anymore, very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: WM

customer_reviews.title: Functions great but...
customer_reviews.text: It works great for a young child's toy in that it plays music and is interactive. It gets 3 stars for the fact that I just noticed that it was wired incorrectly. The French horn button plays the Flute and the Flute button plays the French horn. So this toy doesn't fully teach what each sounds like correctly and falls a little flat ;-) on the early child development side. Try a little harder on the quality control munchkin toy products and I hope I can safely switch the buttons myself since I believe i'm outside of the return window.
customer_reviews.author: TC-nznk

customer_reviews.title: Mozart that a child can love and in a durable easy to use form. Delightful!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my great granddaughter who is 13 months old. She loves it and her mom tells me she turns in on all the time. The way it is designed is very interesting. The top plays the music (there are 5 melodies) with all the instruments in it. Once the whole tune is played you can push on one of the other sides for example the flute and the flute plays the melody by itself so the child can hear it in a pure form. Push on the harp and the harp will play the tune. Very sturdy, too.
customer_reviews.author: J. Eyre

customer_reviews.title: We all love this for 1-year old. :)
customer_reviews.text: I have a musical background and my daughter is a music director and I bought it for her 1-year old. Every kid this age loves music. He loves it. Mozart is my favorite composer so that’s why I ordered it. Some of the notes are not how the music was composed but that’s being picky (just bugs my own brain haha). Every child should have music in their life and this is a terrific toy. Not annoying at all. Your child will play with this (at age one, at least). Very sweet toy.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Top baby AND toddler toy
customer_reviews.text: Our 19 month old has CONSISTENTLY played with this toy throughout his life. He played with it so much that we had to change the batteries but I think we took apart wrong and screwed it up so we gave up and bought another one. This is truly a toy that ages well with babies and doesn't have annoying music for the adults around. He plays this along with other musical toys and instruments he has and gets his own one-man-band going. It's adorable! This would make a great shower or 1st birthday gift.
customer_reviews.author: PARI'

customer_reviews.title: 8 month old Grandson Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my new grandson's 1st Christmas. Most everything was wrapped under our tree except for this and a ride on toy. He went to this immediately & started playing music before even removing from box. Once easily removed from the box, he was smiling, happy playing with his new toy. I was so happy to see this adorable 8 month old so filled with joy.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Cecere

customer_reviews.title: Birthday Gift Success
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a birthday gift for my niece's one-year-old son. I based my decision on reviews posted by other customers. Older kids at the party were thrilled at the gift, other parents loved the choice, and the birthday boy figured out how to use this within five minutes and played with it the rest of the night. Thanks for making me a really cool aunt who is encouraging him to love music.
customer_reviews.author: zuzus petals

customer_reviews.title: Love the upgraded design, wish functionality had not changed.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter and I still fight over her original Munchkin Mozart, she is 15. We bought this to gift to the child she babysits. The old design when you hit any button, including the full orchestra the song didn't change, it just adjusted what instruments you heard. Now only the individual instruments do that. If you hit the full orchestra button it switches songs. We always hated toys that switched songs everytime the child hit the button.
customer_reviews.author: Squirrel

customer_reviews.title: Staple in my baby “must haves”
customer_reviews.text: So giving this 4 stars because I’ve had 3 of these. One was the original version that was actually a cube and then another 6 years ago with my daughter. It’s become a staple in my baby toy “must haves”. I was a little sad when I received this one during this pregnancy because all the colors light up orange when pressed. I thought I remembered previous versions staying true to their colors when lit up. Otherwise, still a lovely toy and will be cherished by this baby as well.
customer_reviews.author: Home Made Possible

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful musical toy
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my 9 month old grandson's favorite toys. At first I had to push the panels but he can now do it himself. I love how you can have all the instruments playing or select just one or two. There is a nice selection of music and my grandson rocks back and forth when it plays. He has dropped it and it is very durable. He watches the lights flash as the instrument plays. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: the sound of the individual instruments is not distinct
customer_reviews.text: This is the new version of an earlier toy and the quality has gone down considerably. The sounds in the original toy were believable renditions by each instrument. With the new version, some of the so-called instruments sound the same. The earlier version had the ability to truly blend the sounds from distinct musical instruments. The sound from the new version is muddled and simply seems to get louder with the addition of a new "instrument." I suppose a very young child will still enjoy pressing the buttons and hearing noise, but the original premise was much more educational and enjoyable. It appealed to both very young and older children. Very sad.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: Meh, I wouldn’t waste your money..
customer_reviews.text: I came across this just after I had my son. I had it put up for months waiting until he was big enough to give it to him. Kinda disappointed. It really doesn’t catch his attention for more than about a min and he LOVES music. All the circles light up the same color. Each circle is a different color, but they all light up orangish. Pic included so you can see what I mean. Wish I hadn’t bought it so early so I could still return it.
customer_reviews.author: Lovingessentialliving

customer_reviews.title: I like this. My son likes it
customer_reviews.text: I like this. My son likes it. Not much left to say. It has multiple instruments that will start playing as you press its buttons, and pressing another instrument lets it join in. The orchestra button sounds off all instruments. Its well built, has lights that blink, and the sound quality is good as well. My son has dropped it/thrown it several times and it shows no sign of abuse. It is a tad heavy, so if it was dropped on a foot, it would probably hurt some.
customer_reviews.author: C.Will

customer_reviews.title: Gift for my Grad daughter
customer_reviews.text: My daughter in-law is very musical so, to her, the typical toys that make music are more like noise makers. I found this one and she loves it and more importantly my 6 month old Granddaughter thinks it's great. she easily pushes the buttons to make the different instrument sounds and the volume can be subdued so you don't feel like your talking over it. Watching her play with it I can see she will be entertained by it for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: It can take a beating!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my one-year-old who likes to carry it with her around the house. She has dropped it quite a few times without any damage to the cube. The cube, as we call it, is a source of constant entertainment. My daughter loves to be her own D.J. and enjoys playing background music while she reads or fiddles with other toys. Well worth the price!!!
customer_reviews.author: G L Whitt

customer_reviews.title: Nice way to learn the sound of various instruments.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this. I got it for a 3 year olds birthday. Which may seem like he is too old for this toy, I think his parents thought that. He loves music though, and I wanted him to learn the individual sounds of each instrument. At night after I read him a story, we listen to a song with just the violin and then add in the flute. Then we listen to 2 more instruments. When I play the whole "band" he laughs with delight. I like that it has 2 different volume levels as well.
customer_reviews.author: zentrainer

customer_reviews.title: Great toy but broke
customer_reviews.text: First of all, not sure if we got a defective one but the buttons on one side just cracked off after only owning this for a month. It was a strange phenomenon for a toy to break in my home even with four kids around... Besides that this toy is awesome if your kid is curious and likes lights, buttons, and music
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: While he seems to like the lights and music
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 4 month old grandson. While he seems to like the lights and music... my 22 month old granddaughter seems to enjoy it even more. This product is of great quality and is designed well. While some of the "musical toys" can be annoying for the adults in the room - this one is rather pleasant for everyone. I'd highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sherrie

customer_reviews.title: Refreshing break from the usual maddening musical toys
customer_reviews.text: Very rare to find a product that has enough interactive lights/sounds/buttons to entertain an infant and yet not drive the parent crazy. It has multiple settings for musical pieces and several different instruments that can be selected to play a specific piece. This is a great gift for anyone that has a child, but it also has a sophistication to it that parents will appreciate.
customer_reviews.author: Helios

customer_reviews.title: Perfect toy for kids (and adults)
customer_reviews.text: I've gifted this toy over a dozen times and it's always been huge hit, both with kids and parents: the music is beautiful, and unlike other "musical" toys this is not a strident, annoying toy. It is also the most solid thing I've ever seen -- it's built to withstand the abuse of the most energetic kids out there and then some. If you're looking for a good toy look no further.
customer_reviews.author: RF

customer_reviews.title: Charming and make great baby gifts
customer_reviews.text: We received this for our twin daughters many years ago and loved it. I've since gifted it several times. As a parent, I remember many a musical toy that I was tempted to make disappear but this music cube is charming. It's so fun to add musical instruments one at a time until you have a symphony.
customer_reviews.author: TA Mom

customer_reviews.title: Baby is obsessed with this wonderful toy!
customer_reviews.text: Sent this to my 7-1/2 month-old grandson for Christmas. He is obsessed with it! The music quality is the best! This is a nice size & shape for him to roll around with in his pack n play, & it keeps him busy for a long time. His mom can tell he's learning as he plays with it. Very exciting gift! A must have!
customer_reviews.author: Tove

customer_reviews.title: Cute and fun, but could be more durable...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 1 year old nephew who loves music. I've had a blast watching him play with it. There's just one thing that it needs. The whole thing is hard plastic, when thrown on the floor by a toddler it's going to crack. It would make much more sense if the outside frame of the cube was made of a more shock absorbing material.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY BEAUTIFUL
customer_reviews.text: Just an amazing toy~ I bought it for my autistic grandson after experiencing it while babysitting a then 10 month old baby girl. My grandson has learned how to add and delete instruments and hums along in perfect key~ I never tire of the sounds which can’t be said of many sound toys! It is the total opposite of the popcorn popper!!
customer_reviews.author: Sayleaway

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!
customer_reviews.text: All five of my kids have loved this toy, enough that we replaced the first one after it had an unfortunate accident with lots of liquid. Just bought one for my 10 month old niece for Christmas. I really like that the kids can add and take away the various instruments. Great gift item!
customer_reviews.author: E Stock

customer_reviews.title: Great little music cube
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a little 3 year old. He is blind, but he loves music, and he loved this. Took it to bed with him every night.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Bozadjian

customer_reviews.title: As a parent it's also nice to have a toy with sound that doesn't give ...
customer_reviews.text: My one-year old enjoys hitting the buttons and hearing the music play and the colors light up. As a parent it's also nice to have a toy with sound that doesn't give you a headache within two minutes. The music is soothing and the idea behind the toy that they can add and subtract different instruments in the song and hear how that changes it is brilliant. I would say its a bit more of an educational toy that will make parents happy, rather than being an absolute kid magnet. But in our household this is a favorite of everyone and pulled down off the shelf for playtime every day.
customer_reviews.author: L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Quality toy- good introduction to classical music.
customer_reviews.text: Sounds good...easy for baby to activate. It's nice to give them some exposure to classical music instead of the same old sappy tunes. Well made...,adds all of the various instruments in the orchestra as the touch each side. Quality toy for an early introduction to good music.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sturdy and cool looking toy
customer_reviews.text: It's a little bigger than we expected but still a cool looking toy. Our kid usually presses the buttons on it when the music stops playing after a bit and then gets busy with something else, only to come back and press one of the buttons again to play same or some other kind of music.
customer_reviews.author: Atif Sarfraz

customer_reviews.title: Baby loves it
customer_reviews.text: Easy for an 10 month old to press and play. We noticed that sometimes during play, she will reach over to start the music and then resume playing with her other toys. She enjoys the music in the background. Not an annoying sound for the adults either even with repeated renditions!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: good example of "good" music toy
customer_reviews.text: gifted this to 18 month old who immediately began pushing buttons....face lit up as music started and buttons flashed....too soon to tell about durability though it looks like it will be with rounded corners, hard plastic construction, doesn't look like it will crack or break easily
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Fun and smart (hopefully) toy!
customer_reviews.text: We have a fair amount of stupid toys and I felt like we needed a smart one, and this definitely fits the bill. Our little is only 8 months, but he's figured out that all the different sides play music, so he enjoys hitting them and starting/stopping the music. I enjoy playing with all the sides (it's fun to see what a song sounds like without the instruments) so I'm guessing he'll keep enjoying this one as he gets older.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah K

customer_reviews.title: Granddaughter loves it!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our granddaughter. She will be a year old in November. She really likes this toy. The past few weeks she has really started on how to operate this toy. She loves it. Her 4 year old brother likes to come along and help her play with it. The music from this toy isn't aggravating like some other baby and toddler toys. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca L. Teeple

customer_reviews.title: Unique learning toy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my 1 year old great granddaughter who loves music. Very unique toy as she has the option to hear just each instrument individually play a selected song or a combination up to all five. I like how the lights flash in rythm with each individual instrument. Has a high volume and low volume switch. Easy for her to handle as she plays with it.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Least Annoying Sound Making Toy
customer_reviews.text: Our nine month old loves this toy. The buttons are big enough that he can push them himself, and there are enough songs and combination of instruments for it not to become immediately annoying like so many other toys that make noise. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Zak F.

customer_reviews.title: but my 35 year old son loved it too
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my grandson, but my 35 year old son loved it too.Very soothing. Great for all ages. I will buy this product again. I seriously looked for an adult cube, but there is none! I was told the adult version is called a CD. I think they missed the point.
customer_reviews.author: Savtie585

customer_reviews.title: nice music
customer_reviews.text: This is a great way to introduce classical music and several instruments to a baby or toddler. It's well made and durable. The music plays well and is not too loud. My only criticism is the flute is being held wrong. My grandson loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Xyz

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift. Funny story... I bought this for my grandbaby and her other grandmother bought it too. Great minds think alike. We both gave it as a Christmas gift and laughed when we found out we bought the same gift. They'll use the extra one with the future child. They're happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: L. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great toy! The music and lights are interesting without being annoying like most toys. Easy for my 10 month old to press the buttons, and it rolls really well to further engage her. There are 2 volume settings that do a good job of giving either a regular noise level or loud option.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon gets all my money

customer_reviews.title: This is a fantastic toy with eight melodious tunes that make a child ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic toy with eight melodious tunes that make a child interested. The fact that a child can press any of the six sides of this cube makes it more enjoyable. The sound level (volume) is just perfect and the orchestra side is decently loud which my child enjoys immensely. The overall size of the toy is also very good and a child can press the sides with his/her full palm which improves dexterity. The colours on the tabs are very vibrant and look beautiful. In all, a brilliant musical toy! Very happy with the purchase. The packaging was also secured and as expected from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The music is great and he’s entertained.
customer_reviews.text: My son loves music and buttons... so this was a big hit for his first birthday. It’s small enough that he can carry it around with some effort but just big and heavy enough that throwing it isn’t an option. The music isn’t annoy. It’s sweet and the low setting is low enough that he can hear it while sitting with it, but I can’t hear it across the room. Huge win.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyable music, durable
customer_reviews.text: Bought this at 3 months, now at almost 8 months and still a favorite. It has 6 different songs with pleasant tones. You can play each song with the full orchestra or separate and unique combinations of instruments. He loves to bounce it around all over the floor now and it seems to be holding up very well.
customer_reviews.author: missistroh

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t recommend. Too heavy -
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure why a baby/kid would like this toy. It’s too heavy to begin with. The music is too confusing to the touch. It always start over the same song unless you press the same button again and again. Didn’t make sense to me. There are better options out there.
customer_reviews.author: Glenda

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok for music
customer_reviews.text: Bought and returned this music cube. My 10 month old didn’t find it interesting. The music is fine I thought I’d like it but it was a boring toy. Besides pressing the giant button for music there’s not much interaction required.
customer_reviews.author: hbn45

customer_reviews.title: How about real sound recording
customer_reviews.text: My $30 Casio keyboard from the 1980s had better sound. Given how cheap memory chips are, there is no reason real recordings of the musical instrument could not have been used.
customer_reviews.author: Complexlitigator

customer_reviews.title: Great musical toy!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this! My 6 year old Autistic son loves musical toys and although this is targeted towards babies in general it has been a great gift. Larger than I expected, but the music is very nice, has two volume settings and I the lights aren't obnoxious. Like others have said, I don't actually mind when he carries this around and plays the same tune over and over.
customer_reviews.author: breesygirl

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, surprisingly durable
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my infant son. Once he actually got interested in it (around 6 months old), he fell in love with it! Beteeen the music and lights, it's amazing. And boy will it take a beating!! He has been picking it up and throwing it (he's surprisingly stron at 9 months old 🤯), and it still works, hasn't chipped or broken (we have tile floors) and rolls right across the floors. I will say that it does kind of hurt when it's dropped on your foot or ankle, but it will keep playing music all the time! Definitely would buy again! 💙
customer_reviews.author: Andira Luce

customer_reviews.title: Love this! One of the only noisy toys of ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this! One of the only noisy toys of my daughter's that I can tolerate listening to for hours when she plays with it. It was a first birthday present for her and she loves it and plays with it all the time. Definitely a worth while purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mandi B

customer_reviews.title: Niece likes it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my niece’s one year birthday. She absolutely loves music, so I thought this would be a good choice. My sister has sent me several videos of her sit-dancing to it, so I think it was a hit!
customer_reviews.author: Stacie S.

customer_reviews.title: Such a cool toy.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased one of these years ago when our now 14 year old was a baby. She loved it. Back then, it was yellow and more straightly cube shaped. The white color and rounded cube shaped sides are both improvements for looks and handling. The sound is not as great quality as the older version, but it is still a fun toy...our 14 year old is playing with this new one that we just purchased!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda H. McBride

customer_reviews.title: A special music toy
customer_reviews.text: This is a very special toy. Grownups enjoy it a lot too, it is fun for our 12 month old and all ages up. The 12 month old likes to touch the ball to make it light up and play. The sound is very pleasing, the variety of Mozart songs very nice. I like that the music won't go unless you touch it. If you stop touching it the song will stop at the end and won't start again until you do it again. It is fun to try out different combinations of instruments, or to only hear one instrument part play.
customer_reviews.author: Pdx consumer

customer_reviews.title: Instruments don't match up to the buttons
customer_reviews.text: Though the idea is great, in the item we received the "french horn" and "violin" buttons are switched. So when you press the french horn the violin plays, and when you press the violin the french horn plays. Pretty disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: excellent toy
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my doctor for her two year old daughter and she loved it. They took a trip to the beach and my doctor told me that this toy kept her daughter completely occupied for the whole two hour trip in the car.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: IF you want your baby to....
customer_reviews.text: ...develop an appreciation of good music, this is probably as good a place to start as any. Mozart is programmed into this little device. My grandson loves it, they tell me. Seems sturdy enough
customer_reviews.author: The Flylooper

customer_reviews.title: My Husband Has Taken This Toy Over
customer_reviews.text: Well, I did buy this for our baby but my husband plays with it all the time! It is a wonderful toy and I think it has a lot to teach little ones about music and how individual instruments fit together to form a beautiful piece of music. It’s a very stimulating and educational toy for little kids and big kids alike!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M.

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the older version
customer_reviews.text: The product looks modern but you can see cost cutting. The plastic enclosure doesn't align properly. The volume is low. You'd have to have a quite room to hear it well. The product overall feels a little flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this toy
customer_reviews.text: I mean... my 7-month-old doesn't really "get" it yet, in terms of adding and removing different instruments from the song - but the good news is that he doesn't have to "get it" to use it, and I think it is awesome! Also, the music it makes is actually nice compared to many other loud and obnoxious baby/toddler toys. And it has huge, easy, attractive buttons that the baby will learn how to use quickly. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: L Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase! Baby loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 6 month old, and they love it. The age says 12 months, but my baby absolutely loves it. It's much larger than I thought it would be, but that's a good thing in this instance. Glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: RaeTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Seems my grandson has some music appreciation at 10 months!
customer_reviews.text: This toy is a real winner! My 10 month old grandson absolutely loves it. He will be crawling somewhere and if you tap it & the music starts playing he instantly stops in his tracks and begins rocking back and forth to it. It is so adorable to watch him. Us grownups like the tunes as well. He can lightly touch it and start the music up as well. Great gift!
customer_reviews.author: Char

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: The only flaw is that they used synthesizer sounds instead of real instruments. That was a huge disappointment because they all sound the same. However the concept is great, it works for all ages, it plays several different types of tunes, and there are two volume levels.
customer_reviews.author: BookMD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect soothing gift for new baby
customer_reviews.text: Granddaughter fell in love and we’d turn on next to her when changing diapers and she’d be fascinated and stay still..We’d live the music and different instruments.... Always give as a baby gift!
customer_reviews.author: S. K. schultz

customer_reviews.title: 1 year old grandson loves music
customer_reviews.text: My 1 year old grandson loves music so I bought him this musical cube. He loves it! I maybe purchasing more for friends grandchildren....easy to listen to instruments and colorful. Very pleased with purchase
customer_reviews.author: loves to read

customer_reviews.title: What I don’t like about this product is there isn’t a short and ...
customer_reviews.text: What I don’t like about this product is there isn’t a short and long version of the music-once you tap one side, it plays through the entire song. If you tap another side, it adds into the song.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Warren

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorites for my children
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic toy for a toddler it plays nice music at a reasonable level keeping the parent sane:-) and the lights and music keep my toddler entertained for hours. Also very durable since my toddler is a 2 year old boy and decided to throw it across the room on our wood floor still working fine and not a ding on it
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Very interactive
customer_reviews.text: Got this for Christmas for my 6 month old. She doesn't quite understand it yet, but she loves rolling it around. I've played around with it quite a bit and have gotten some enjoyment out of it (; . It's very interactive and neat to see how you can build different orchestra sounds, the various sounds each instrument makes, and how they sound selecting ones to play together.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great, but...
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Orchestra button only lasted two month before it got stuck :( Beautiful new design. Plays very pleasant music. Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Edelweiss26

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it for me and mine.
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected. It's like one song. Each side plays an instrument but definently doesn't hold a toddlers attention long at all. Would not recommend personally.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Much beloved baby toy
customer_reviews.text: We wore through two of the old square model with 3 of our kids. So with baby #4 we replaced it with the new version. It works about as well as the previous, I prefer the previous more square design. It seems as though two of the instruments are reversed on ours, but so far it's not irritating enough to replace! This is by far our favorite baby toy and has been much loved by all four of our children. It is my go to baby gift, the music is not irritating!
customer_reviews.author: CMaskell

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my one year old niece at Christmas. She loved it from day one. She now dances to it's music and is able to turn it on with her toes/foot so she doesn't have to quit dancing. She also drags it over to use as a step to get up on things. An unexpected use!
customer_reviews.author: Sue, Illinois

customer_reviews.title: Five month old just LOVED it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 5 month old grandson for Christmas. It didn't take long for him to determine how to make the music play. It excited\s him to make it play.
customer_reviews.author: MDMom

customer_reviews.title: Introducing him to different music has been made easy....thank you
customer_reviews.text: He absolutely loves this! And I love the fact that he's getting introduced to so may different types of music. This is a great gift and brings us both a lot of pleasure.
customer_reviews.author: ShayF

customer_reviews.title: HUGE fan
customer_reviews.text: it has 2 volume settings which i really love. i wish it came with more songs but when baby presses any button with an instrument it will activate/deactivate the sound it makes in the song. It actually helped my daughter learn to sit up so i am a HUGE fan of this. if your baby likes music, i highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kayla U.

customer_reviews.title: This is one of those toys that makes noise that ...
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those toys that makes noise that you don't mind. It teaches the sounds of instruments, as well as colors, and words through the use of classical music, and I don't mean those awful children's versions but with the actual piece of music. It was huge hit with my 1 year old niece who didn't put it down all day.
customer_reviews.author: Janna West

customer_reviews.title: Perfect toy for the motor skills we're working on right ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 7 months old and isn't very interested in sitting for long periods of time... until this toy. It has helped a lot with getting her to sit up and she loves the buttons. Perfect toy for the motor skills we're working on right now. A++
customer_reviews.author: minimalist.mom

customer_reviews.title: Lack of quality control
customer_reviews.text: The one and only issue is that the violin and flute are reversed as in the buttons and sounds don't match up. Is there a way to fix this? Without this issue, it would be a great toy.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: YES!!
customer_reviews.text: Yes! Just what we were looking for!!!!! Beautiful classical music and not annoying! The ball is not cheap plastic that’s going to break.great quality and worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Great great toy loved by the children
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughters all love this toy, from 7 mos. to almost 4 years old. The music is lovely, it handles use/abuse and it is a pleasure to turn on!
customer_reviews.author: COH

customer_reviews.title: One of babies favorite toys!!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my babies favorite toys. She loves the songs, and the lights on this and it appears to keep her attention every time she plays with it, unlike other toys. Would definitely buy for a gift, and would recommend to family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: James B.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful-Musical
customer_reviews.text: Love this. the music quality is fine - rather like a good synthesizer. It is a nice change from electronic nursery songs and digital faux pop. Fun for grandma too.
customer_reviews.author: L. Warren

customer_reviews.title: OPTIONS I LIKE
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product. They baby seems to enjoy the music and I can always turn it off.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Costa

customer_reviews.title: Love! Love!
customer_reviews.text: Each side of the cube is a different instrument in an orchestra. You can play the instruments separately or add them in together to hear the full orchestra. Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Janet D

customer_reviews.title: A Lot of Fun
customer_reviews.text: This toy is not only fun but educational. Be careful! If you play with it, you won't want to give it back to the child you took it from!!
customer_reviews.author: Brillant Barbara

customer_reviews.title: I love this, the music is lovely
customer_reviews.text: I love this, the music is lovely. I like it more than my baby, does; I usually play the songs with just the flute and harp, lol. It definitely lets you see how crucial an instrument the piano is to most musical scores.
customer_reviews.author: isonian

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic first Year
customer_reviews.text: Great first year with this baby device. Introduce babies with noise level appropriate music enough that I can hear them from another room. Very simple and basic yet my niece loved this.
customer_reviews.author: Xena

customer_reviews.title: Music to my ears!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this toy!!! Unlike other musical toys this one is soft and not annoying. Children can play certain instruments in the orchestra while not playing others.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Y.

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: A present for a 7 mo baby. It provides a relief from usual repetitive children songs and exposes the baby to classical music. The gift was welcomed and approved by the parents.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Munchkin Mozart Magic Cube (Style May Vary)
product_meta.description:
At one point or another, every parent has experienced a particularly loud and headache-inducing toddler toy. But believe it or not, there are toys that make beautiful music too. Perfect for all ages, the award-winning, newly redesigned Mozart Magic Cube inspires creativity and interactive play while teaching how sounds combine to create eight classical music masterpieces by the master composer. With a touch of a button, this interactive cube lets your child add or subtract from any combination of five different instruments, including harp, French horn, piano, flute and violin. Each selected instrument button flashes to the tempo of the music. An orchestra button even plays all the instruments at once. The Magic Mozart Cube provides a fun musical foundation for your little one. And that's music to your ears - in more ways than one.

Song list includes:

 * Non Piu Andre (Marriage of Figaro)
 * Country Dance #5, K.609
 * Come Sweet May, K.596
 * Ah! Vous Dirai-Je, Maman, K.265 ( Twinkle, Twinkle)
 * Der Vogelfanger (Magic Flute)
 * March in D, K.408
 * Lander, K.606
 * LaCi Darem La Mano (Don Giovanni)
feature_bullets: Educational toy teaches how sounds combine to create 8 MOunceart masterpiece
Includes harp, French horn, piano, flute and violin instrument sounds
Recommended for budding young composers of all ages
Orchestra button plays all instruments. Eight MOunceart compositions included
Sides light up to the tempo of the music
Features bright colors such as yellow, green, purple and magenta
Requires 3 AA batteries (trial batteries included, best with Polaroid AA batteries)
Great for boys and girls of all ages
